name: hypertense

extremely tense (= nervous, worried, and unable to relax): His voice was that of a hypertense teenager, dripping frustration and paranoia. When I'm stressed I can get hyper-tense and breathless.
More examplesFewer examplesThe intelligence services are hyper-tense in anticipation of another attack. Question and Answer sessions can make you hypertense, trying to think up a question, putting your hand up and down.Sophie Ward plays the hyper-tense Katherine, Oliver Wood the amiably disruptive Bizzy and Andrew Scarborough the revolting yuppie.
